lines.text: Don't ever get mixed up with a Chinese goddess. That's the worst thing that can happen, the very worst.
We are but strangers on this moving globe; it's not for us to tarry long.
Taken in sufficient quantities, liquor will make you intoxicated.
The best friendships are made on short acquaintance and last a very brief time.

[to Johnny and Arbutny]
Perhaps you've both heard the Chinese proverb you can only trust love only if there's nothing to be gained by it.
Do you realize what you're asking Kwan-yin to do? We want her to reshuffle a hand that destiny has already dealt us. Why? - because we hope to get higher cards.

[to Crystal]
You only want what you can't have as long as you can't have it.

[to Fallon]
Even if I am a policeman, I hate a squealer.
You know about the psyche?
Psyche?
It's what makes human beings of us.
Is that a fact?
That's a fact. Uh, something is missing from me. Do you know how it is with a man who loses his leg and how the leg he hasn't got itches, and he goes to scratch?
Mmmmm.
It's like that with the missing portion of my psyche anatomy. Whenever it itches, I take a drink. Tonight it's itching like the Devil.
You do not believe in miracles, I see.
Hardly.
Ah, pardon me, sir, but then, ah, what do you believe in?
Who me? I believe in what I can see... what I can get my hands on.
And I believe that those things are not at all real. Who are we to say, uh, that the legend of Kwan Yin is any less real than the iron you tapped with your ring.
I'll stay and witness your miracle as you call it. If it happens at midnight, we have only five minutes to go.
That gives us just time to make our wish.
Wish?
Yes, I mentioned that Kwan Yin would not only open her eyes but her heart as well. Whatever we ask for she will grant.
Oh, that's the kind of lady I like.
The only difficulty is it has to be the same wish for three of us.
What could that possibly be?

I've been thinking about it for several days. You see, the wish I had my heart set on isn't one that I could possibly expect strangers to share, but I found the solution. What I wish can make all others come true.
Eh?
It's very simple... money.
Money? That's all right with me although I think you slightly overestimate its power.
No, I have no objections to money. How much do you suppose the Chinese lady can be, uh, touched for? Two thousand pounds?
Well, that's a very trifling amount, but, eh, I think I can use it.
[He turns out his pockets and they are empty]
You do not believe in miracles, I see.
Hardly.
Ah, pardon me, sir, but then, ah, what do you believe in?
Who me? I believe in what I can see... what I can get my hands on.
And I believe that those things are not at all real. Who are we to say, uh, tha the legend of Kwan Yin is any less real than the iron you just tapped with your ring?
Johnny, I ain't never seen you eat! Not since you've been with us. This is the first time!
I think I'm sober.
